message: why is Python 3.1 and 2.7 recognizing {1,2,3}  but not printing (via str) {1,2,3}
instead you always get an "ugly" set([1,2,3])

This is not the case in my 3.1, and this probably isn't a change that will make it into a 2.7 minor release.

If you still have an idea you want to push forward, try the python-ideas mailing list.
python-ideas  sounds like a good idea -- but I would assume there is a reason that the (nice looking '{1,2,3}') 3.1 behavior was not backported to 2.7
